qas.question: Where does the majority of youtube's revenue go?
In 2010 what were the estimates for the amount of videos with advertisements uploaded without the copywriter's consent?
Which major gaming company claimed copyright ad revenue rights against uploaders?
When did Nintendo finally agree to share ad profits with the original uploaders?
What option besides removing the video does youtube grant copyright holders?

answers.text: have them continue running for revenue

qas.question: What did Nintendo start enforcing in 2015?
What did Nintendo agree to share in 2013?
How many videos with advertisements were uploaded without the copyright holder's permission in 2013?

context: Much of YouTube's revenue goes <a0_0>to the copyright holders<a0_0/> of the videos. In 2010 it was reported that <a1_0><b7_0>nearly a third<b7_0/><a1_0/> of the videos with advertisements were uploaded without permission of the copyright holders. YouTube gives an option for copyright holders to locate and remove their videos or to <a4_0>have them continue running for revenue<a4_0/>. In May 2013, Nintendo began enforcing <b5_0>its copyright ownership<b5_0/> and claiming the advertising revenue from video creators who posted screenshots of its games. In <a3_0>February 2015<a3_0/>, <a2_0>Nintendo<a2_0/> agreed to share the <b6_0>revenue<b6_0/> with the video creators.
